put.description: Sets properties for a storage account's Queue service endpoint, including properties for Storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules

x-ms-request-id.description: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

x-ms-version.description: Indicates the version of the Queue service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

get.description: gets the properties of a storage account's Queue service, including properties for Storage Analytics and CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules.

get.description: Retrieves statistics related to replication for the Queue service. It is only available on the secondary location endpoint when read-access geo-redundant replication is enabled for the storage account.

get.description: Retrieves user-defined metadata and queue properties on the specified queue. Metadata is associated with the queue as name-values pairs.

get.description: The Dequeue operation retrieves one or more messages from the front of the queue.

delete.description: The Clear operation deletes all messages from the specified queue.

post.description: The Enqueue operation adds a new message to the back of the message queue. A visibility timeout can also be specified to make the message invisible until the visibility timeout expires. A message must be in a format that can be included in an XML request with UTF-8 encoding. The encoded message can be up to 64 KB in size for versions 2011-08-18 and newer, or 8 KB in size for previous versions.

get.description: The Peek operation retrieves one or more messages from the front of the queue, but does not alter the visibility of the message.

x-ms-version.description: Indicates the version of the Queue service used to execute the request. This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

put.description: The Update operation was introduced with version 2011-08-18 of the Queue service API. The Update Message operation updates the visibility timeout of a message. You can also use this operation to update the contents of a message. A message must be in a format that can be included in an XML request with UTF-8 encoding, and the encoded message can be up to 64KB in size.

x-ms-popreceipt.description: The pop receipt of the queue message.

x-ms-time-next-visible.description: A UTC date/time value that represents when the message will be visible on the queue.

delete.description: The Delete operation deletes the specified message.

Date.description: UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated

Start.description: the date-time the policy is active

Permission.description: the permissions for the acl policy

QueuesSegment.description: The object returned when calling List Queues on a Queue Service.

CorsRule.description: CORS is an HTTP feature that enables a web application running under one domain to access resources in another domain. Web browsers implement a security restriction known as same-origin policy that prevents a web page from calling APIs in a different domain; CORS provides a secure way to allow one domain (the origin domain) to call APIs in another domain

AllowedOrigins.description: The origin domains that are permitted to make a request against the storage service via CORS. The origin domain is the domain from which the request originates. Note that the origin must be an exact case-sensitive match with the origin that the user age sends to the service. You can also use the wildcard character '*' to allow all origin domains to make requests via CORS.

AllowedMethods.description: The methods (HTTP request verbs) that the origin domain may use for a CORS request. (comma separated)

AllowedHeaders.description: the request headers that the origin domain may specify on the CORS request.

ExposedHeaders.description: The response headers that may be sent in the response to the CORS request and exposed by the browser to the request issuer

MaxAgeInSeconds.description: The maximum amount time that a browser should cache the preflight OPTIONS request.

ErrorCode.description: Error codes returned by the service

Status.description: The status of the secondary location

LastSyncTime.description: A GMT date/time value, to the second. All primary writes preceding this value are guaranteed to be available for read operations at the secondary. Primary writes after this point in time may or may not be available for reads.

Version.description: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.

Delete.description: Indicates whether all delete requests should be logged.

Read.description: Indicates whether all read requests should be logged.

Write.description: Indicates whether all write requests should be logged.

Version.description: The version of Storage Analytics to configure.

Enabled.description: Indicates whether metrics are enabled for the Queue service.

IncludeAPIs.description: Indicates whether metrics should generate summary statistics for called API operations.

QueueMessage.description: A Message object which can be stored in a Queue

DequeuedMessage.description: The object returned in the QueueMessageList array when calling Get Messages on a Queue.

InsertionTime.description: The time the Message was inserted into the Queue.

ExpirationTime.description: The time that the Message will expire and be automatically deleted.

PopReceipt.description: This value is required to delete the Message. If deletion fails using this popreceipt then the message has been dequeued by another client.

TimeNextVisible.description: The time that the message will again become visible in the Queue.

DequeueCount.description: The number of times the message has been dequeued.

PeekedMessage.description: The object returned in the QueueMessageList array when calling Peek Messages on a Queue

InsertionTime.description: The time the Message was inserted into the Queue.

ExpirationTime.description: The time that the Message will expire and be automatically deleted.

DequeueCount.description: The number of times the message has been dequeued.

EnqueuedMessage.description: The object returned in the QueueMessageList array when calling Put Message on a Queue

InsertionTime.description: The time the Message was inserted into the Queue.

ExpirationTime.description: The time that the Message will expire and be automatically deleted.

PopReceipt.description: This value is required to delete the Message. If deletion fails using this popreceipt then the message has been dequeued by another client.

TimeNextVisible.description: The time that the message will again become visible in the Queue.

DequeuedMessagesList.description: The object returned when calling Get Messages on a Queue

PeekedMessagesList.description: The object returned when calling Peek Messages on a Queue

EnqueuedMessageList.description: The object returned when calling Put Message on a Queue

Enabled.description: Indicates whether a retention policy is enabled for the storage service

Days.description: Indicates the number of days that metrics or logging or soft-deleted data should be retained. All data older than this value will be deleted

HourMetrics.description: A summary of request statistics grouped by API in hourly aggregates for queues

MinuteMetrics.description: a summary of request statistics grouped by API in minute aggregates for queues

GeoReplication.description: Geo-Replication information for the Secondary Storage Service

Url.name: url
Url.description: The URL of the service account, queue or message that is the targe of the desired operation.

ApiVersionParameter.name: x-ms-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

ClientRequestId.name: x-ms-client-request-id
ClientRequestId.description: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

ListQueuesInclude.name: include
ListQueuesInclude.description: Include this parameter to specify that the queues's metadata be returned as part of the response body.

Marker.name: marker
Marker.description: A string value that identifies the portion of the list of queues to be returned with the next listing operation. The operation returns the NextMarker value within the response body if the listing operation did not return all queues remaining to be listed with the current page. The NextMarker value can be used as the value for the marker parameter in a subsequent call to request the next page of list items. The marker value is opaque to the client.

MaxResults.name: maxresults
MaxResults.description: Specifies the maximum number of queues to return. If the request does not specify maxresults, or specifies a value greater than 5000, the server will return up to 5000 items. Note that if the listing operation crosses a partition boundary, then the service will return a continuation token for retrieving the remainder of the results. For this reason, it is possible that the service will return fewer results than specified by maxresults, or than the default of 5000.

MessageTTL.name: messagettl
MessageTTL.description: Optional. Specifies the time-to-live interval for the message, in seconds. Prior to version 2017-07-29, the maximum time-to-live allowed is 7 days. For version 2017-07-29 or later, the maximum time-to-live can be any positive number, as well as -1 indicating that the message does not expire. If this parameter is omitted, the default time-to-live is 7 days.

Metadata.name: x-ms-meta
Metadata.description: Optional. Include this parameter to specify that the queue's metadata be returned as part of the response body. Note that metadata requested with this parameter must be stored in accordance with the naming restrictions imposed by the 2009-09-19 version of the Queue service. Beginning with this version, all metadata names must adhere to the naming conventions for C# identifiers.

NumOfMessages.name: numofmessages
NumOfMessages.description: Optional. A nonzero integer value that specifies the number of messages to retrieve from the queue, up to a maximum of 32. If fewer are visible, the visible messages are returned. By default, a single message is retrieved from the queue with this operation.

PopReceipt.name: popreceipt
PopReceipt.description: Required. Specifies the valid pop receipt value returned from an earlier call to the Get Messages or Update Message operation.

Prefix.name: prefix
Prefix.description: Filters the results to return only queues whose name begins with the specified prefix.

QueueMessage.name: message
QueueMessage.description: A Message object which can be stored in a Queue

Timeout.name: timeout
Timeout.description: The The timeout parameter is expressed in seconds. For more information, see

VisibilityTimeout.name: visibilitytimeout
VisibilityTimeout.description: Optional. Specifies the new visibility timeout value, in seconds, relative to server time. The default value is 30 seconds. A specified value must be larger than or equal to 1 second, and cannot be larger than 7 days, or larger than 2 hours on REST protocol versions prior to version 2011-08-18. The visibility timeout of a message can be set to a value later than the expiry time.

VisibilityTimeoutRequired.name: visibilitytimeout
VisibilityTimeoutRequired.description: Optional. Specifies the new visibility timeout value, in seconds, relative to server time. The default value is 30 seconds. A specified value must be larger than or equal to 1 second, and cannot be larger than 7 days, or larger than 2 hours on REST protocol versions prior to version 2011-08-18. The visibility timeout of a message can be set to a value later than the expiry time.
